definitions.text: improve or perfect by pruning or polishing
make more complex, intricate, or richer
treat or prepare so as to put in a usable condition
reduce to a fine, unmixed, or pure state; separate from extraneous matter or cleanse from impurities
attenuate or reduce in vigor, strength, or validity by polishing or purifying
examples: many valuable nutrients are refined out of the foods in our modern diet

definitions.text: make more precise or increase the discriminatory powers of
examples: refine the constant in the equation

definitions.text: (used of persons and their behavior) cultivated and genteel
examples: she was delicate and refined and unused to hardship

definitions.text: freed from impurities by processing; ; ; - Shakespeare
showing a high degree of refinement and the assurance that comes from wide social experience
examples: maintained an urbane tone in his letters

definitions.text: free from what is tawdry or unbecoming
examples: she hated to have her neat plans upset
